response:
Now I'll calculate the percentage of female speakers for each play by year and find the mean percentage per time period to analyze the trend.

Looking at the data, I can calculate:
- For each play: (numOfSpeakersFemale / numOfSpeakers) × 100
- Then find the mean percentage for different time periods

Let me organize this data by decade:

**1880s (1880-1889):**
- 1880: Gillets hemlighet (17.6%), 1881: Anno fyrtiåtta (25.0%), Mäster Olof (17.1%)
- 1882: Herr Bengts hustru (56.3%), Lycko-Pers resa (16.3%), Två valspråk (63.6%)
- 1883: En hufvudsak (75.0%), "Hvarför?" (75.0%), Elfvan (71.4%), Sanna kvinnor (57.1%), Skådespelerskan (50.0%), Under toffeln (60.0%)
- 1884: Dömd (53.3%), En lektion (50.0%), Småstadslif (47.4%), Rospiggarna (29.7%), Vårflod (62.5%), Höstslask (0.0%)
- 1885: Efterspel (40.0%), Final (30.0%), Kärlek (62.5%), Hur man gör godt (46.3%)
- 1886: Ensam (42.9%), "Förlåt mig!" (33.3%), Marodörer (54.5%), Krypskyttarne (0.0%)
- 1887: I telefon (62.5%), Konstnärns förtviflan (50.0%), Fadren (44.4%), Mödrar (70.0%), Jennys förmaningar (33.3%), Lucias ziffror (71.4%)
- 1888: Fröken Julie (50.0%), Kamraterna (38.5%)
- 1889: Romeos Julia (16.7%), Station Sylvester (32.4%)

**1890s (1890-1899):**
- 1890: Den starkare (100.0%), Fordringsegare (33.3%), Paria (0.0%), Samum (33.3%), På vakt (50.0%), Askungen (61.5%)
- 1891: Den kärleken! (66.7%), Familjelycka (77.8%), Moster Malvina (88.9%)
- 1893: Första varningen (80.0%), Moderskärlek (100.0%), Inför döden (50.0%)
- 1894: Lars Anders och Jan Anders och deras barn (30.8%)
- 1895: I "fruntimmersveckan" (66.7%)
- 1896: I det gröna (54.5%), Otteringning (66.7%), Ett pojkstreck (42.9%), Perdita (22.2%), Skogskonungen (40.0%), Snurran (36.0%), Tidernas spegel (100.0%)
- 1897: Bandet (12.5%), Farmors födelsedag (58.3%), På fotvandring (57.1%), Fru Leonora (50.0%), Den nya klassen (35.7%), I små maffarnas land (25.0%), Jeppe och Murra (50.0%)
- 1898: Till Damaskus (31.9%)
- 1899: När nyår kom (33.3%), Nu är det jul igen (33.3%)

**1900s:**
- 1900: Ingrid (42.9%)

**Mean percentages by decade:**
- 1880s: ~48.5%
- 1890s: ~50.8%
- 1900s: 42.9% (only one play)

**Answer:**
The mean percentage of female speakers in Swedish drama shows a slight increase from the 1880s (~48.5%) to the 1890s (~50.8%), then drops in 1900 (42.9%), though this
